result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L Stowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon L Stowe in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has completed the AODA as requested.  There is no request for license suspension.  Court pronounces sentence.  $200.00 fine + costs = $694.00; give DNA sample + $200.00 DNA surcharge.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant Brandon L Stowe in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has completed some counseling but not an AODA.  DA questions if he intends to get the AODA treatment before sentencing.  Defendant wishes to get the assessment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety.
Pictures & prints.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Brandon L Stowe in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1.  Citizenship and probation information noted.  Arguments as to penalty.  Defendant indicate he may loose his job if he looses his driver's license.  If defendant gets a drug test within the next month and has a clean UA, DA will not recommend a suspension.  Will have to bring in proof at next hearing.  Sentencing postponed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
